00048 class HAL_CAN : public GenericIOInterface {
00049 
00050 
00051 
00052 private:
00053         HW_HAL_CAN* context;
00054 
00055 
00056 /* public functions */
00057 
00058 public:
00059         HAL_CAN(CAN_IDX canIdx);
00060 
00061         /* Initialization of uart interface: mode 8N1, no HW flow control*/
00062         int init(unsigned int baudrate);
00063 
00064         /* disable interface and set all its registers and pins to its reset state */
00065         void reset();
00066 
00067         /* Configuration of uart interface AFTER initialization */
00068         int config(CAN_PARAMETER_TYPE type, int paramVal);
00069 
00070         int status(CAN_STATUS_TYPE type);
00071 
00072         //Called when all data has benn transmitted
00073         bool readyToSend();
00074         //Called when a message is ready to read
00075         bool dataReady();
00076 
00077 
00078         /**
00079          * Add a filter for incoming Messages. Only Message with pass a filter are received. Filters may be implemented in hardware an can be limited.
00080          * Also one ID should only match with one filter.
00081          * @param ID CAN ID (11bit for standard frame 29 bit for extended frame, always right justified)
00082          * @param IDmask every bit that is 1 here is don't care (11bit for standard frame 29 bit for extended frame, always right justified)
00083          * @param RTR frame?
00084          * @retval true when filter was created, false if not(no more hw rescources?)
00085          */
00086         bool addIncomingFilter(uint32_t ID, uint32_t IDMask=0, bool extID = true, bool rtr=false);
00087 
00088 
00089 
00090 
00091         /**Transmit CAN Message, non-blocking if there is space in outputbuffer
00092          *@param sendBuf pointer to transmit dara
00093          *@param len lenth of transmit data( max. 8 bytes)
00094          *@param stdID CAN ID (11bit for standart frame 29 bit for extended frame, always right justified)
00095          *@param rtr send RTR frame?
00096          *@retval -1 on error 0 on success
00097          */
00098         int write(const char* sendBuf, int len,uint32_t canID,  bool extID = true, bool rtr=false);
00099         /** Receives CAN Message, non-blocking
00100          * @param recBuf dataBuffer, must have space for 8 bytes
00101          * @param stdID CAN ID of received frame (11bit for standard frame 29 bit for extended frame, always right justified)
00102          * @param rtr was it a rtr frame?
00103          * @retval number of databytes or -1 if nothing was received
00104          */
00105         int read(char* recBuf, uint32_t* canID=0, bool* isExtID = 0,bool* rtr=0);
00106
